channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023110616
item.description:
Report X-2023110616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: OTTUMWA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the box was found to be wet, authorized personnel were notified and the package and all other possibly damaged packages were taken to QA for further proccessing DescribePack: A cap on one of the jugs came loose causing the contents to leak out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put into a tote and taken to QA for further processing

item.title: Report X-2023110605
item.description:
Report X-2023110605

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was discovered on Unload that it was leaking. It was taken by QA to the Hazmat cage in a red tote. DescribePack: The plastic must have deteriorated around the closure (where the lid is). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill outside the box was minimal so it was cleaned according to the MSDS.
